subclusters.subcluster_name: Metal and Glycation-Related Accumulated Damage Theory
Mitochondrial and Proteostasis Damage Accumulation Theory
Genomic Instability and DNA Damage Accumulation Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Metal and Glycation-Related Accumulated Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on metal bioaccumulation and advanced glycation/lipoxidation end products (AGEs/ALEs) causing molecular damage and self-reinforcing complexes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Metal and Glycation-Related Accumulated Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes reactive species, transition metal bioaccumulation, AGEs, ALEs, and autocatalytic feedback loops driving damage accumulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial and Proteostasis Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights mitochondrial dysfunction, oxidative stress, loss of proteostasis, and deregulated nutrient sensing as key damage mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial and Proteostasis Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on genomic instability, oxidative stress, mitochondrial dysfunction, and metabolic burden causing damage accumulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial and Proteostasis Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on oxidative damage accumulation to proteins and decline in proteolytic degradation leading to damage buildup.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial and Proteostasis Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details oxidative protein damage, accumulation of oxidized proteins, functional decline, and intervention by free radical scavengers.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial and Proteostasis Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes oxidative damage by ROS, DNA damage, and decline in repair system efficiency contributing to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial and Proteostasis Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Includes oxidative stress, chronic inflammation, mitochondrial decline, and impaired autophagy as damage drivers.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial and Proteostasis Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on progressive mitochondrial damage accumulation, functional decline, and environmental/dietary modulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial and Proteostasis Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes cumulative molecular damage to proteins and DNA disrupting homeostasis and multifactorial aging mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial and Proteostasis Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes stochastic biomolecular damage accumulation, genetic and extrinsic modulation, and cellular stress response.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Extracellular and Metabolism-Induced Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on metabolism-induced molecular damage, extracellular vs intracellular damage, and therapeutic repair of extracellular damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and DNA Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights stochastic molecular errors, insufficient repair, entropy increase, and DNA repair capacity's role in longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and DNA Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on random genetic mutations, somatic mutation theory, DNA repair, and error catastrophe in protein synthesis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and DNA Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes macromolecular damage accrual including DNA, genomic instability, heterochromatin loss, and stem cell fatigue.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and DNA Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on genetic damage accumulation, antioxidant protection reducing damage, and mutation load correlating with mortality.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and DNA Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes DNA damage accumulation in hematopoietic stem cells, epigenetic remodeling, inflammaging, and metabolic regulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and DNA Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on DNA-protein crosslink accumulation, differential tissue accumulation, and impaired DNA repair accelerating aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and DNA Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights DNA damage accumulation, telomere attrition, mitochondrial dysfunction, and chronic inflammation targeted by gene therapy.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and DNA Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes molecular and cellular damage accumulation, physiological decline, and genetic modifications linked to adaptive processes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and DNA Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links insufficient sleep to accelerated biological aging via epigenetic damage, DNA damage, inflammation, and cellular senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Environmental Damage and Neuronal Attrition Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on environmental toxins causing subclinical neuronal damage interacting with age-related neuronal loss and vulnerability.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Metal and Glycation-Related Accumulated Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes multiple synergistic causes including oxidative stress, glycation, mutations, and protein aggregation contributing to damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and DNA Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Presents aging as inevitable damage accumulation modulated adaptively by repair efficiency without a specific aging program.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial and Proteostasis Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-related decline in translational capacity affecting protein synthesis and meiotic spindle stability in oocytes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and DNA Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes random molecular damage accumulation, breakdown of maintenance mechanisms including stem cell exhaustion and genomic instability.
